results.title: The Cloudmaker
results.creator_credit: Leah Miller, Pieter Van Deusen and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Animation, in which a tiny figure struggling in a gigantic electro-mechanical world challenges the viewer to think about how one can live, work and fit into, and find satisfaction in a large technological society. No commentary, music soundtrack only.

results.title: The Clifford rotary cultivator
results.creator_credit: G Burger, Clifford Aero and Auto Ltd and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: Describes and illustrates the rotary cultivator, the machine that does the ploughing, harrowing and cultivating in one operation. Commentary by Frank Phillips.

results.title: The Cleo Laine collection
results.creator_credit: Graeme Rowland, Bill Ramsey and de Montignie Productions
results.brief_description: Recorded live at the Melbourne Concert Hall in 1986, this video presents the sensuous and sultry jazz and blues singer Cleo Laine performing with her husband John Dankworth and the Dankworth Quartet. British born Cleo Laine began her musical career in the early 1950s where she met and married renowned musician John Dankworth in 1958. Together they have toured the world (and still currently touring) but Cleo has also tried her hand at acting on the stage in such plays as “Flesh to a tiger”, “A Midsummer night’s dream” and the title role in Ibsen’s “Hedda Gabler” among many other performances. Songs from this Melbourne concert by this great lady include “Free and easy”, “I love you just the way you are”, “Crazy rhythm”, “Send in the clowns”, “He was beautiful”.

results.title: The City of the dead = Horror hotel
results.creator_credit: John Moxey, Donald Taylor and Vulcan Film (UK)
results.brief_description: A young college student, intrigued by the historical practices of witchcraft conducted in the 17th century, travels to a small town for further investigation. There she meets a mysterious end, leaving her brother and boyfriend to uncover the truth about the town’s malevolent inhabitants. Filmed in black and white, and released the same year as Hitchcock’s “Psycho”, this horror tale is suitably menacing, relying very little on special effects, but more on atmosphere and a chilling narrative. Also known as “Horror hotel”.

results.title: The Christmas tree
results.creator_credit: M Tsekhanovsky, P. Nosov and Cartoon Film Studios
results.brief_description: An animated Christmas story for young children, in the Disney style, about the forest animals gathering snow-covered Christmas trees in preparation for the Christmas festivities. Father Christmas in the meantime is driving his sleigh through the forest gathering gifts, only to be hindered by two mean foxes. Fortunately the forest animals come to his aid and to celebrate, Father Christmas waves his magical wand to produce a beautiful large Christmas tree covered with gifts. At the stroke of midnight, all the animals and Father Christmas dance around the tree. Russian dialogue - no subtext.

results.title: The City of lost children [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jean-Pierre Jeunet, Marc Caro, Claudie Ossard, France 3 Cinema, Lumière and Studio Canal+
results.brief_description: An extraordinary film from the makers of “Delicatessen”. Krank lives on a lonely oil rig in a swirling sea. He cannot dream and is aging prematurely so he kidnaps young children hoping to steal their sleeping thoughts. On a quest to find his young brother, a fairground strongman called One sets off on a series of fantastical adventures to rescue the lost children.

results.title: The Charwoman
results.creator_credit: Leonard Forest, Roger Blais and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: At daybreak, while the rest of Ottawa sleeps, a small army of workers is astir, setting in order the houses of government for the business of the day. This film presents a whimsical sketch of a charwoman who knows every nook and cranny of the stately House of Commons and who dreams wistfully of the brighter future her young daughter may have as a result of her labors with mop and pail.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leonard Forest, Roger Blais and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Champions. Pt. 2
results.creator_credit: Donald Brittain, Janet Leissner, Peter Katadotis and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Rene Levesque and Pierre Elliott Trudeau, Canada’s chief political protagonists, are the focus of this two part documentary. Part one covers their early years up to 1967. Using rare photos, newsreel footage and interviews with close political colleagues, the film provides the background to the struggle between the two men and their ideologies. In doing so, it helps to illuminate a great crisis in Canadian history. Awards: Toronto

results.title: The Citizen rebels = Il cittadino si ribella
results.brief_description: Carlo, a self-employed industrial engineer is held at gunpoint by a gang of hoodlums while he is queueing at the local post office. In a struggle to conceal his money from the thugs he is beaten senseless, abducted, and left for dead in their abandoned getaway vehicle. When the local police fail to act on his behalf, Carlo decides to take the matter into his own hands, firstly through his lawyer (who is helpless to assist him), then by his own less legitimate devices. Cast includes Franco Nero and Barbara Bach. In Italian with no English subtitles.

results.title: The Circle
results.creator_credit: Mort Ransen, John Kemeny and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Produced in 1967, this black and white film is an inmate’s view of Daytop, a drug treatment center on Staten Island, New York, where addicts learn to get along without drugs. Uncompromising, often brutal group therapy sessions are designed to shake loose the excuses a victim makes for himself. The people and situations shown are authentic; only one actor was employed. The results obtained at Daytop are regarded by some psychiatrists as a breakthrough. Cast: Don Francks.
